column3: REFILE-COLUMN-Big banks want your big bucks  but ask questions

column3: Bank of America struggles  but asset sales help

column4: Bank of America Corp is selling its 49 percent stake in 4 World Financial Center in Manhattan to Brookfield Office Properties Inc.  Bloomberg News reported Monday  citing a person with knowledge of the situation.

column3: Wall Street sit-in goes global Saturday
column4: LONDON For an October revolution  dress warm. That's the word going out - politely - on the Web to rally street protests on Saturday around the globe from New Zealand to Alaska via London  Frankfurt  Washington and  of course  New York  where the past month's Occupy Wall Street movement has inspired a worldwide yell of anger at banks and financiers. | Video

column3: UPDATE 1-Democrats ask US Justice Dept to probe bank fees

column3: IRS will not go after airline fare hikes

column3: Congress reaches deal to end FAA shutdown

column3: HP names Whitman CEO  Apotheker out
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Hewlett-Packard Co named former eBay Inc Chief Executive Meg Whitman its president and CEO  replacing the harshly criticized Leo Apotheker in a bid to restore investor confidence in the U.S. technology company.

column3: HP may oust CEO  hire eBay veteran: source
column4: Hewlett-Packard Co's board convened on Wednesday to consider ousting Chief Executive Officer Leo Apotheker after less than a year on the job and replacing him temporarily with former eBay CEO Meg Whitman  a source familiar with the matter said.

column3: HP execs misled investors before August stock crash: lawsuit
column4: Hewlett-Packard Co and top executives misled investors for months before unveiling a series of major decisions  such as the demise of the TouchPad  that hammered its shares  a shareholder alleged in a proposed class-action lawsuit filed this week.

column3: Venture capital veteran Perkins sees danger ahead
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Tom Perkins  co-founder of Kleiner Perkins and the backer of companies ranging from Genentech to Google  believes much of the venture-capital industry has set itself up for failure.

column3: Tablet boom prompts Gartner to cut PC market view
column4: HELSINKI Research firm Gartner slashed its growth forecast for the global PC market this year to 3.8 percent from 9.3 percent  citing slower economies in Western Europe and the United States  and a boom in media tablets.

column3: Two Rambus patents invalidated after ITC wins
column4: WASHINGTON  Sept 9 Two patents that chip designer Rambus  used to win patent lawsuits against Nvidia Corp   Hewlett-Packard  and others have been declared invalid by the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office  according to legal documents.

column3: Tablet boom prompts Gartner to cut PC market view
column4: HELSINKI Research firm Gartner slashed its growth forecast for the global PC market this year to 3.8 percent from 9.3 percent  citing slower economies in Western Europe and the United States  and a boom in media tablets.

column3: Analysis: Exits show how few women make it to CEO in U.S.
column4: BOSTON For advocates of gender equality  this week's ouster of two of Corporate America's most powerful women served as a reminder of how little progress U.S. companies have made in promoting women to executive positions.

column3: HP exec says PC unit spinoff "best value"
column4: BEIJING A spin-off of Hewlett-Packard Co's PC unit would be the best value for shareholders  according to the head of its PC division  who added that tablet computing was "relevant" to the future market for any spinoff.

column3: Murdoch and son get big bonuses  James declines
column4: NEW YORK News Corp awarded Rupert Murdoch and his son James big compensation increases  though James declined his bonus  citing controversy over a phone hacking scandal at the UK newspaper unit that he oversees.

column3: UPDATE 1-Best Buy cuts price of RIM PlayBook for weekend
column4: * RIM shipped 500 000 PlayBooks in first months after launch

column3: Former Galleon trader handed 5-1/2-year sentence
column4: NEW YORK A former trader at the Galleon Group hedge fund was sentenced on Wednesday to five-and-a-half years in prison  a term the judge said should serve as a warning to Wall Street that insider trading was a serious crime.

column3: Oracle brings new claims against HP in Itanium case
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Oracle Corp accused Hewlett-Packard Co of fraud for concealing facts during negotiations between the two companies  according to a court filing.

column3: HP says prefers to spin off PC unit
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Hewlett-Packard said on Monday it prefers to spin off its personal computers unit and is currently working on understanding the larger implications of separating the business from the company.

column3: LPC-HP loan shows investment-grade strength amid macro concerns
column4: NEW YORK  Aug 26 (LPC) - Hewlett-Packard Co announced two weeks ago it was acquiring Autonomy for $10 billion. Backing the transaction was a $8.3 billion 364-day bridge loan solely underwritten by Barclays Capital.

column3: Investors sanguine as Apple's Jobs steps aside
column4: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Apple Inc's first day without Steve Jobs as chief executive looked awfully similar to most other days: its share price beat the broader stock market. | Video

column3: Analysis: Outlook for tech spending getting darker
column4: BOSTON Hopes are rapidly dwindling that there will be even modest growth in technology spending during the second half of 2011. And 2012 may be no better.

column3: European stores slash prices for defunct HP tablet
column4: LONDON/FRANKFURT  Aug 23 European retailers slashed prices for Hewlett-Packard's TouchPad computers on Monday and Tuesday after just seven weeks on the shelves  in the wake of the U.S. company's announcement that it would kill off the tablet.

column3: Bargain hunters tiptoe back but remain cautious
column4: NEW YORK U.S. stocks ended slightly higher on Monday after four weeks of losses as investors hesitated to take big risks without a catalyst for buying. | Video

column3: Analysis: HP - Dial "M" for mayhem
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Leo Apotheker's credibility as a CEO is falling along with Hewlett-Packard's stock price.

column3: Wall Street sinks for fourth straight week
column4: NEW YORK Wall Street ended a fourth week of losses on a down note on Friday as most buyers left the market before the weekend on growing fears of another U.S. recession and destabilization in Europe's financial system. | Video

column3: UPDATE 6-HP sinks as investors flee business revamp
column4: * Shares close off 20 percent  worst day since 1987  (Adds analyst comment  share price update)

column3: Salesforce bucks tech trend  boosts outlook
column4: BOSTON Web-based software maker Salesforce.com Inc raised its full-year revenue outlook  fueling hopes that cloud computing companies can avoid getting caught up in a possible slowdown in tech spending.

column3: Tech shares fall on weakness  NetApp down late
column4: NEW YORK Tech shares fell on Wednesday after Dell's disappointing sales outlook fanned worries weak economic growth will hurt earnings in the third quarter. | Video

column3: Cable execs wary as Google acquires Motorola boxes
column4: NEW YORK The pay-TV industry is nervously watching Google Inc's acquisition of Motorola Mobility -- the largest supplier of set-top boxes to consumers' homes.

column3: BUY OR SELL-BMC Software: growth play or too cheap to ignore?
column4: * Shares off 16 pct since Q1 numbers  but had pvsly touched decade-high

column3: Computer Sciences a likely target for breakup
column4: NEW YORK After a series of failed takeover attempts and accounting scandals  Computer Sciences Corp is attracting potential activist investors looking to take advantage of a weak share price to push for a breakup.

column3: Analysis: Tech world vies for piece of insurance exchanges
column4: WASHINGTON The U.S. government effort to set up state-run health insurance exchanges may be falling behind schedule  but technology firms are lining up for the lucrative contracts to build the network's infrastructure.

column3: UPDATE 2-Avnet Q4 profit beats; to buy back shares
column4: * Shares up about 9 percent   (Adds details on share buyback  updates share movement)

column3: Tesla names automotive newcomers as Model S execs
column4: DETROIT Tesla Motors named four executives  none from the automotive industry  to help the Silicon Valley company prepare for the mass production of its Model S car  which is due out in 2012.

column3: Cisco  networking companies deal with more bad news
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Wall Street underestimated the effect of cuts in government spending on the networking industry and may have to curtail its expectations again with growing fears of a global economic slowdown.

column3: HP offers TouchPad on discount month after launch
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Hewlett-Packard Co is offering a hefty discount on its TouchPad tablet a month after it launched the WebOS-based mobile device in a booming market dominated by Apple Inc's iPad.

column3: Analysis: Enterprise flash storage market ripe for tie-ups
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Competition is brewing in the small but booming market for flash memory used in corporate data centers  and analysts foresee a wave of consolidation as larger players move in.

column3: BUY OR SELL-Hard drive makers brace for softer times
column4: BANGALORE  Aug 1 Slowing demand and the rising popularity of more power-efficient flash drives will hurt hard disk drive makers  led by Western Digital Corp and Seagate Technology   just as they head into what is traditionally the strongest sales season.

column3: HP chairman sees turnaround as long-term project
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Turning around troubled Hewlett-Packard is a long-term project that will require more investment in the business  company chairman and venture capitalist Ray Lane said.

column3: Timberlake to Gaga: Hollywood courts social media
column4: LOS ANGELES When you think of Bono or Lady Gaga  the term "Silicon Valley entrepreneur" hardly springs to mind.

column3: UPDATE 3-TI forecasts modest third quarter
column4: * Says seeing lukewarm production in computing  consumer

column3: Xerox's lowered cash forecast irks investors
column4: NEW YORK Xerox Corp  warned it would have less operating cash than expected this year  partly because it has to absorb added costs related to the earthquake in Japan  sending its shares down more than 2 percent.

column3: HP authorizes $10 bln more for share buybacks
column4: SAN FRANCISCO  July 21 Hewlett-Packard  said on Thursday that its board has authorized another $10 billion for future purchases of outstanding shares  sending its shares 1.3 percent higher in after hours trading.

column3: Apple rolls out new Macs  shares set record
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc shares flirted with a record $400 on Wednesday  a day after the world's most valuable technology company posted blockbuster results and triggered a spate of brokerage upgrades. | Video

column3: Cisco to cut workforce by 15 percent  sell factory to Hon Hai
column4: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Cisco Systems plans to cut 15 percent of its staff and sell a set-top box factory as part of a plan to cut annual expenses by $1 billion as the network equipment maker tries to revive its fortunes.

column4: * Sets positive tone for tech earns  corporate spending

column3: Apple chief patent lawyer leaving: sources
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc's chief patent counsel will soon leave the company  at a time when the iPhone maker is fighting numerous legal battles around the world  according to sources familiar with the situation.

column3: RIM annual meeting likely to exacerbate investor ire
column4: TORONTO Research In Motion investors desperate for news about how the BlackBerry maker will reverse its sagging fortunes will likely leave Tuesday's annual meeting with their frustrations even more inflamed.

column3: China's factories falter  pro-growth policies eyed
column4: BEIJING China's factory activity shrank again December as demand at home and abroad slackened  a purchasing managers' survey showed on Friday  reinforcing the case for pro-growth policies to underpin the world's second-largest economy. | Video

column3: HSBC's Losango sale in Brazil faces hurdles: report
column4: The sale of HSBC Holdings'  consumer finance unit in Brazil is facing serious hurdles  mainly disagreements with potential bidders on price  a local newspaper said on Wednesday.

column3: HSBC sells its private bank in Japan to C. Suisse
column4: SINGAPORE  Dec 21 HSBC  Europe's biggest bank  has agreed to sell its private banking business in Japan to Credit Suisse  the bank said on Wednesday.

column3: Tiger will add spice to Abu Dhabi event: Kaymer
column4: DUBAI Martin Kaymer is excited at the prospect of taking on former world number one Tiger Woods at next month's Abu Dhabi Championship  the German said on Saturday.

column4: HONG KONG  Dec 8 AXA SA and Assicurazioni Generali SpA are among bidders shortlisted for HSBC Holdings Plc's  planned sale of its general insurance business  sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

column3: Analysis: Answers to the 7 big "what-ifs" of debt default
column4: NEW YORK The debt negotiations are getting down to the wire. Republican and Democratic lawmakers are scrambling to broker a deal to raise the country's $14.3 trillion debt ceiling before Tuesday  when the Treasury will no longer be able to borrow funds to meet all of its obligations. It all means the United States could face the possibility of defaulting on its debt and losing its prized triple-A credit rating.

Other featured studies include those for medicines designed to raise "good" cholesterol. The meeting runs until Wednesday.--------------------------------

column3: Clearwire rallies on subs growth  MetroPCS deal talk
column4: NEW YORK Clearwire Corp reported  better-than-expected subscriber numbers on Thursday  while MetroPCS Communications  said it is interested in spectrum deal with the wireless telecommunications company.

column3: Verizon denies Clearwire talks  eyes LTE devices
column4: SAN DIEGO The chief executive of Verizon Wireless denied on Tuesday the No. 1 U.S. mobile service is talking with Clearwire Corp about the possibility of using the smaller operator's wireless airwaves in high-demand areas.

column3: Apple's iPhone 4S breaks early order record
column4: People who want the new $200 Apple iPhone 4S may have to get in line on Friday because U.S. wireless phone carriers appear to have sold out.

column3: Sprint seeks to raise capital; investors flee
column4: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel Corp said it needs to raise more money and signaled it will burn through its cash reserves  raising concerns about the wireless provider's financial stability and business strategy.

column3: Sprint to sell iPhone with unlimited data service
column4: Sprint Nextel plans to offer customers who buy the Apple Inc iPhone its unlimited data service for a flat monthly fee  potentially putting pressure on bigger rivals Verizon Wireless and AT&T Inc.

column3: Sprint confirms plan to sell iPhone
column4: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel confirmed that it will sell the next version of Apple Inc's iPhone  ending months of speculation about whether it would become the third U.S. operator to sell the popular device.

column3: Sprint to buy 30.5 million iPhones over 4 years: report
column4: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel Corp shares fell more than 10 percent after a report that it committed to buy at least 30.5 million iPhones that would cost it about $20 billion in the next four years.

column3: Cook's time to shine with new Apple iPhone
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Tim Cook finally gets his chance to stride out from under Steve Jobs' shadow  and he could not have picked a better time or device to mark his unofficial debut as Apple Inc's CEO.

column3: AT&T seeks Sprint  Cellular South cases dismissed
column4: AT&T Inc has asked a U.S. judge to dismiss antitrust lawsuits brought by rivals Sprint Nextel Corp and Cellular South  now called C Spire Wireless  to halt AT&T's proposed $39 billion purchase of T-Mobile USA.

column3: T-Mobile lines up against Apple in Samsung lawsuit
column4: T-Mobile USA has become the latest mobile provider opposing Apple's bid to stop Samsung Electronics Co from selling some Galaxy products in the United States  according to a court filing.

column3: T-Mobile lines up against Apple in Samsung lawsuit
column4: T-Mobile USA has become the latest mobile provider opposing Apple's bid to stop Samsung Electronics Co from selling some Galaxy products in the United States  according to a court filing.

column3: T-Mobile USA promises speed boost from new phones
column4: T-Mobile USA plans next month to launch two smartphones that double the speed of its wireless data service in the hope of attracting new customers to the No. 4 U.S. mobile provider.

column3: Clearwire talks capacity with AT&T  Verizon  others
column4: NEW YORK Clearwire Corp is in talks with U.S. wireless operators  including AT&T Inc and Verizon Wireless  about selling network capacity while it also eyes raising new funding through equity  debt and vendor financing  according to top company executives.

column3: Judge sets February 13 date for AT&T antitrust trial
column4: WASHINGTON A U.S. judge set a February 13 start for a trial over whether AT&T Inc can buy rival T-Mobile USA  a compromise between the companies' desire for a quick resolution and the Justice Department's request for more time to prepare its case.

column3: Analysis: AT&T may have to settle for weaker T-Mobile tie-up
column4: NEW YORK/FRANKFURT If AT&T Inc fails to convince U.S. regulators that its proposed purchase of Deutsche Telekom AG's T-Mobile USA should go ahead  the pair may end up having to settle for a lesser relationship.

column3: Google and Visa team up on mobile payments
column4: Google Inc has enlisted Visa Inc in its effort to push mobile payments  striking an agreement to allow Visa account-holders to pay for store purchases with their smartphones.

column3: Fifteen lawmakers ask Obama to OK AT&T merger
column4: Fifteen Democratic lawmakers asked the Obama administration on Thursday to approve AT&T Inc's  proposed purchase of T-Mobile USA.

column3: AT&T could lower T-Mobile bid price if remedies grow: report
column4: Bangalore AT&T Inc can lower the price it pays for T-Mobile USA Inc if the remedies requested by regulators become too expensive  a Bloomberg report said  citing three people with direct knowledge of the merger contract.

column3: Sprint sues to block AT&T's proposed T-Mobile buy
column4: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel sued to stop AT&T Inc's $39 billion purchase of T-Mobile USA  staking out its own private antitrust claims alongside the U.S. government's challenge to the deal.

column3: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business news - Sept 5
column4: Sept 5 The following were the top stories in The New York Times business pages on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column3: AT&T prepares two-track plan to save T-Mobile deal
column4: NEW YORK AT&T Inc is expected to soon present a proposed solution to U.S. antitrust regulators to salvage its planned $39 billion acquisition of smaller rival T-Mobile USA  according to people close to the matter. | Video

column3: Court battle looms between U.S. and AT&T  T-Mobile
column4: NEW YORK/WASHINGTON The Justice Department made a bold move when it sued to block AT&T Inc's $39 billion acquisition of T-Mobile. Now comes the hard part: going to court.

column3: AT&T T-Mobile left in dark about antitrust lawsuit
column4: WASHINGTON AT&T CEO Randall Stephenson appeared on cable television early on Wednesday to tout his $39 billion deal to buy T-Mobile USA and how it could bring back 5 000 jobs to the United States from overseas once done.

column3: FCC clock resumes on AT&T/T-Mobile deal review
column4: NEW YORK/WASHINGTON The Federal Communications Commission said it has restarted the clock on its review of AT&T Inc's  proposed $39 billion purchase of smaller rival T-Mobile USA.

column3: Sprint to start selling iPhone 5 mid-October: report
column4: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel will start selling the next version of the Apple iPhone in mid-October  according to a report in the Wall Street Journal that cited unnamed sources.

column3: Sprint to start selling iPhone 5 mid-Oct: report
column4: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel will start selling the next version of the Apple Inc iPhone in mid-October  according to a report in the Wall Street Journal that cited unnamed sources.

column3: Setback for Sprint in motion against TerreStar
column4: A bankruptcy court has denied Sprint Nextel Corp's  motion for a partial summary judgment in a proceeding against bankrupt mobile satellite network operator TerreStar Networks Inc   U.S. Bancorp  and others.

column3: Sprint  cable operators in Clearwire talks: sources
column4: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel Corp  has held talks with cable partners about supporting their loss-making Clearwire Corp  wireless venture in the face of increasing competition from bigger rivals  according to two people familiar with the matter.

column3: Sprint ditches 4G model of RIM PlayBook
column4: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel Corp has scrapped plans to sell a high-speed version of Research In Motion Ltd's PlayBook tablet because of slack demand  delivering another blow to BlackBerry phone maker.

column3: Sprint sees slower business buying decisions
column4: NEW YORK The technology chiefs at corporate customers are slowing down decisions about spending due to economic uncertainty  according to a top executive of Sprint Nextel.
